intro: Campulosus dolichostachys, commonly known as the long-stalked campulose, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and ray florets. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. The flowers bloom in clusters, producing a showy display that attracts pollinators like bees and butterflies.
